text: Identify the spyware.
note: Spyware is also known as Spybot, or tracking software.

text: Pick the non-legitimate software.
note: Tracking software is otherwise known as spyware or spybot. They keep track of all your confidential information and pass it to hackers, which can prove to be potentially dangerous.

text: Spyware are malicious programs that, after downloading itself on a PC, begin to transmit some type of information through the Internet, except:
note: Spyware is interested only in spying on you. It gathers all your sensitive personal information, like your browsing history, PC's hardware and software configuration, email address, online activity, etc.

text: Which of the following operating systems employs Kerberos authentication?
___________ tool is used for sniffing a network.
note: Cain and Abel is a multiple-use utility that can be used to sniff a network, crack hashes, etc.

text: Which of the following are rootkit functionalities?

answers.text: To elevate the privileges of processes
To hide files or registry entries

note: The rootkit is one of the most dangerous hacking tools available to the dark side. A tool like this does not require that much skill. But to function, it must have access to the system itself in order to place the rootkitted processes, files, or whatever on that computer.

text: How can rootkits be prevented?
note: Anti-rootkits can provide a maximum level of security against rootkits as they are specifically designed for this purpose.

text: Which is the strongest password among these?
note: P@5S\/\/OrD is a combination of numbers, letters, symbols, and special characters, which makes it really difficult to crack.

text: How can password guessing be prevented?

answers.text: Using alphanumeric passwords with both uppercase and lowercase letters
Using Syskey and storing key on an external drive

note: Using long passwords with a combination of numbers and uppercase/lowercase characters will make generated hashes much stronger against GPU cracking. The more the number of characters, the more possible password combinations.

text: SetWindowsHookEx() is a Windows function used by:
note: Software keyloggers is correct: Software keyloggers use the Windows function SetWindowsHookEx() to hook with a DLL file to handle all the logging functions. This software monitors all the keystrokes and can even capture auto complete passwords.

text: Identify the hardware keyloggers.
note: Wireless keyloggers are a type of hardware keylogger that can collect packets of data transmitted from a wireless keyboard to its receiver. If the connection is not secure, the wireless keylogger can easily break the encryption.

text: The following steps can help you stay protected, except ______.

answers.text: Never using an administrator account daily

note: Using free file sharing sites is correct: Use of free file sharing sites is very dangerous as a majority of the freeware contains spyware hidden in it.

text: Select all the following programs that will not protect your PC.
note: Torrent is a free sharing site where you can download videos, audios, software, and much more. All the freeware includes spyware hidden in it.

text: It is safe to install all search engine toolbars.
Antivirus software is spyware.
There is a difference between legitimate tracking software and spyware.
When you visit some websites, you will get a popup asking you to install ActiveX or a similar plug-in. This is known as a drive-by download.
The keylogger works in combination with spyware and cannot be programmed to start and end when the user is prompted to enter a username and password in any browser window.
Zeus can alter the memory table that is associated with your browser and control the logging functions.
Keyloggers run at ring 0.
Antivirus and antispyware programs fail to detect kernel-based keyloggers because, they ______.
note: User level applications run at ring 3 and keyloggers operate at ring 0. And, antivirus and antispyware are user level programs running at ring 3.

text: Which of the following, when installed on a PC, can include a kernel-based keylogger?
note: Rootkits are one such malicious software that gets installed in the kernel and hides there. They also include kernel-based keyloggers.

text: Almost all programs contain spyware code.
Antivirus and antispyware program can detect the data stored in the hardware keyloggers.
Amac is a keylogger designed for the Windows operating system.
